title: Google Recorder crashes and cannot start, I have more than 1GB of recordings I cannot lose, help
content:
Hello,
on my Pixel 4a, I have the last RQ3A.210605.005 Android update and after the last (Google) Recorder update 2.3.378307099 the Recorder does not start! It crashes, freezes and only tells me "App has stopped" / "Recorder keeps stopping".
I have more than 1GB of sound recordings I cannot lose, and as you know, they are hidden from the user (unless I root the phone presumably, which I do not want to do.)

I of course tried everything, forcing the app to stop, deleting cookies. I of course cannot delete App Data or reinstall the app. I have all the possible updates. My only idea here would be to downgrade, but that is not an option without uninstalling the app.

I also want to add that I do not have all of these backuped in recorder.google.com,
as there is anyway no way of downloading them through that website externally,
so I didnt use it.

What do you recommend?
Shell I wait for an another app update with the hopes that it will fix the problem and I will be able to export the recordings?
Shell I boot to safe mode and see if it changes anything?
https://support.google.com/pixelphone/answer/2852139#zippy=%2Cif-your-phone-is-on
Is rooting the phone the only option really? (To see the folder /data/data/com.google.android.apps.recorder/files/recordings )

Error log / screens can be downloaded here:
https://1drv.ms/u/s!ApA-lU4RlEhdarMvL57fJYUTZJ4?e=1xaZjY

What other alternative options are there?
If necessary, tell me what other info you need.

Thank you in advance for any tips. I am the first and only user of my original Pixel 4a, I am caring for it and until now, I was really a big fan of Pixel.. But now .. I am not so sure anymore.

(my contact email of the Android account is myknowkiafone@gmail.com)


Daniel
